meanings.definition: To make or become Greek in character or style.
meanings.sent1: She tried to grecianize her home by adding columns and statues.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant grecianized its menu by adding traditional Greek dishes.
meanings.sent3: He grecianized his wardrobe by wearing a toga to the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist grecianized the sculpture, giving it a classical Greek look.
meanings.sent5: The garden was grecianized with marble statues and fountains.

meanings.definition: To imitate or adopt Greek customs or traditions.
meanings.sent1: The school play grecianized ancient Greek customs for the audience.
meanings.sent2: She decided to grecianize her wedding by incorporating Greek dances.
meanings.sent3: The family grecianized their holiday celebrations with Greek music and food.
meanings.sent4: The museum exhibit grecianized the ancient artifacts, bringing Greek history to life.
meanings.sent5: The theater production grecianized the story of the Greek gods with elaborate costumes.
